title: Baker on scourge of discrimination - context

content.description:
“Current sit-ins and other demonstrations are concerned with something much bigger than a hamburger.... Whatever may be the difference in approach to their goal... students, North and South, are seeking to rid America of the scourge of... discrimination—not only at lunch counters, but in every aspect of life.”

Ella Baker, “Bigger Than a Hamburger,” Raleigh, NC, 1960
content.question: The excerpt best serves as evidence of which of the following developments during the 1960s?

choices.label: New demands for economic rights by Latino Americans
Efforts to combat racism in the labor movement
Increased conflict over the role of women in society
Growing pressure to eliminate racial inequalities in society

content.answer: Growing pressure to eliminate racial inequalities in society

skill.text: Skill 4.A: Identify and describe a historical context for a specific historical development or process.
